mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Fears he will be in Bedford when Mr. Correa wishes to visit, however, he will be at Monticello for the months of July and August, when harvesting is done. This will be shortened in 1813 because of "the ravages of the fly."
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1813 May 30, Monticello, [Albemarle County, Virginia], to William Short, Philadelphia, [Pennsylvania].
